column2: KENTUCKY DMV TEST
column4: Kentucky
column6: KY

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Drivers may cross a double yellow line to pass another vehicle if:
column4: the yellow line next to their side of the road is broken.
column6: the yellow line next to the other side of the road is broken.
column8: the vehicle ahead moves to the right to let them pass.

column2: 2. This sign means:
column4: The lane ahead is reserved for bicycles.
column6: Bicycles should yield to vehicles ahead.
column8: Warning: a bikeway crosses the roadway ahead.

column2: 3. You may drive faster than the posted speed limit:
column4: when passing another vehicle, as long as it is safe to do so.
column6: Under no circumstances.
column8: when your lane is empty.

column2: 4. This sign means:
column4: 270 degree turn ahead.
column6: Roundabout ahead.
column8: Wrong way; Turn around immediately.

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column4: You must bear either right or left
column6: A road joins from the left
column8: A 3-way intersection is ahead

column2: 6. A flashing yellow light:
column4: is used at dangerous intersections.
column6: warns drivers to proceed with caution.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 7. Broken yellow lines:
column4: separate lanes of traffic moving in opposite directions.
column6: separate lanes of traffic moving in the same direction.
column8: indicate you are in a no passing zone.

column2: 8. When they see this sign, drivers:
column4: should be prepared to make sharp turns at a high speed.
column6: should not speed up or brake quickly.
column8: need to be prepared to turn right and then left quickly.

column2: 9. When they see this road sign, drivers should:
column4: drive carefully because the animal pictured on the sign is extremely rare in the area.
column6: park in the zoo area.
column8: watch for this species crossing the road.

column2: 10. This sign means:
column4: Road slippery when wet. Drive slowly.
column6: The road will curve to the right, then to the left.
column8: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.

column2: 11. When passing a pedestrian who is walking on the road and an oncoming vehicle is approaching, you should:
column4: slow down and let the vehicle pass first.
column6: honk your horn to warn the pedestrian.
column8: keep driving, you have the right-of-way.

column2: 12. When changing lanes:
column4: change lane before checking the inside rearview mirror.
column6: slow down and check your left mirror.
column8: look over your shoulder to make sure no one is in the blind spot.

column2: 13. In 55 MPH traffic you are least likely to be involved in a collision if you:
column4: drive a few MPH faster than most.
column6: stay within that speed range.
column8: drive a few MPH slower than most.

column2: 14. If you are blinded by headlights on an approaching vehicle, you should:
column4: move your eyes to the right.
column6: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 15. A yellow arrow means:
column4: The same as a steady yellow light.
column6: If you intend to turn in the direction of the arrow, be prepared to stop.
column8: Do not go in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 16. A driver cuts off another vehicle, or threatens another motorist or a pedestrian. These are examples of:
column4: defensive driving
column6: road rage
column8: excessive driving

column2: 17. How can you prevent fatigue on a long trip?
column4: Get enough sleep.
column6: Plan to drive long trips with a companion.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 18. When driving on gravel roads:
column4: your tires do not have as much traction.
column6: you should use cruise control to increase traction.
column8: you should keep your eyes moving.

column2: 19. This road sign means:
column4: Merging Traffic
column6: Wrong Way
column8: Curve ahead

column2: 20. The sign in the picture:
column4: is found at most intersections and indicates that drivers must yield to other vehicles.
column6: is a Construction and Maintenance Traffic Control sign.
column8: is displayed on the rear of slow moving vehicles.

column2: 21. If a bus needs to make a right turn and you are also turning right:
column4: squeeze between the bus and the curb.
column6: wait until the bus turns before turning right.
column8: try to turn right before the bus does.

column2: 22. What should you do if your rear wheels start to skid?
column4: If the vehicle has ABS, pump the pedal carefully.
column6: Steer left if your rear wheels slide right.
column8: Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.

column2: 23. Before making a left turn from a one-way street, you must:
column4: be in the lane closest to the left curb.
column6: be in the lane closest to the center of the street.
column8: be in the lane closest to the right curb.

column2: 24. To avoid traction loss from hydroplaning, drivers should:
column4: slow down.
column6: keep a constant speed.
column8: apply the brakes as soon as the car starts to skid.

column2: 25. An emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can be unpredictable. Why?
column4: Emergency vehicle drivers are not required to be careful.
column6: Emergency vehicles must go faster than the posted speed limit when it is safe to do so.
column8: The driver can legally pass red lights.

column2: 26. What is a likely effect when you take another drug while you drink alcohol?
column4: The effects of the alcohol and the drug are enhanced.
column6: There are no effects, unless the drug is prescription only.
column8: If the drug is over-the-counter, there are no effects.

column2: 27. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: the road ahead is narrow.
column6: there is a one lane bridge ahead.
column8: the right lane ends.

column2: 28. Yellow traffic signs:
column4: guide drivers.
column6: warn drivers.
column8: when combined with an octagonal shape, tell drivers they must come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 29. If a traffic officer signals you to drive through a red light:
column4: you must do it.
column6: you must not obey the officer. Signs and signals take precedence over directions given by traffic officers.
column8: you must wait for the red light to turn green.

column2: 30. When turning, drivers should:
column4: increase their speed to improve stability.
column6: always move to the right lane.
column8: check traffic in all directions.

column2: 31. A traffic sign with a red circle around and a slash over a symbol means:
column4: the maneuver shown on the sign should be executed with extreme caution.
column6: the maneuver shown by the symbol is not allowed.
column8: Do not drive faster than the posted speed limit.

column2: 32. This road sign means:
column4: Winding road
column6: Double curve ahead
column8: Pavement ends

column2: 33. After passing a vehicle, it is safe to return to your lane when:
column4: you can see both headlights of the vehicle you just passed in your rearview mirror.
column6: the driver you passed slows down to let you return to your lane.
column8: you are at least 100 feet ahead of the vehicle you passed.

column2: 34. What is the meaning of red traffic signs?
column4: Regulatory.
column6: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.
column8: High emphasis warning.

column2: 35. Continuous hard braking on ice and snow often:
column4: causes the front wheels to lock.
column6: keeps the brakes from freezing.
column8: is the best option during winter.

column2: 36. This road sign is:
column4: a speed reduction sign.
column6: a regulatory sign.
column8: a warning sign.

column2: 37. This road sign means:
column4: Left turns are not allowed where this sign is displayed.
column6: Vehicles turning left must make a U-turn.
column8: Drivers cannot make a complete turn to go in the opposite direction.

column2: 38. This road sign means:
column4: U-turns are prohibited
column6: Drivers may proceed if the way is clear
column8: Drivers are about to enter a one way street the wrong way

column2: 39. This road sign means:
column4: Stop sign ahead
column6: Merge right
column8: Reduction in lanes

column2: 40. If cars approaching from opposite directions reach an intersection at the same time:
column4: a car that turns right must yield to cars that move straight or turn left.
column6: a car that turns left must yield to cars that move straight or turn right.
column8: a car that moves straight must yield to cars that turn left.
